result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd H. Edgar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED AND STAYED
Huber and transfer to Barron County granted.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall not have any contact with victim by any means.
Defendant shall not post any electronic media or social media about or to victim or victim's family.
Defendant shall not be in visual contact of victim.
Defendant shall not be within 1000 feet of victim's residence.
Defendant shall not be within one block of victim's vehicle.
Defendant shall not reside in Fennimore or within three miles of Fennimore.
Defendant shall not have any contact with victim's children.
Defendant shall not be on premises of Kwik Trip, Decker Drive, Rice Lake.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd H. Edgar

defendant.name: Edgar, Todd H.
defendant.address: 808 S. Wisconsin Ave. Apt. 1, Rice Lake, WI 54868

records.addlTxt: Defendant Todd H. Edgar in court.  Attorney Ryan Kieler in court for Todd H. Edgar.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend charge to misdemeanor disorderly conduct with 2 years probation, no contact with victim, not to be within 1000 feet of victim's residence or one block of her vehicle, no contact with victim's children, counseling, psych evaluation, take prescribed medications, costs. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Court grants amendment. Defendant pleads no contest. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Victim heard. State heard. Attorney Kieler heard. Court orders 90 days jail with work release and transfer to Barron County, imposed and stayed, 2 years probation with conditions: Defendant shall not have any contact with victim by any means; defendant shall not post any electronic media or social media about or to victim or victim's family; not to be in visual contact of victim; not to be within 1000 feet of victim's residence; not to be within one block of victim's vehicle; not to reside in Fennimore or within three miles of Fennimore; no contact with victim's children; defendant shall not be on premises of Kwik Trip, Decker Drive, Rice Lake. Costs remitted on all counts.
